SENT.plain: This study aimed to investigate the protective effects of Ginkgo biloba extract on cerebral vasospasm and neural damage following subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) in rats
It was found that the regional cerebral blood flow decreased immediately and persistently after SAH in SAH rats
The latency of somatosensory evoked potential delayed progressively
The nitric oxide levels in serum and brain tissue decreased and increased, respectively, after SAH
Ginkgo biloba extract effectively antagonized the changes of above parameters
It was concluded that somatosensory evoked potential is useful for the judgement of cerebral ischemic damage during cerebral vasospasm after SAH
Decrease in serum nitric oxide and increase in brain tissue nitric oxide are important factors leading to cerebral vasospasm and neural damage, respectively, after SAH
Ginkgo biloba extract relieves cerebral vasospasm and cerebral ischemic damage by reversing the pathological alteration of nitric oxide
